title.en: Development of Materials I: Classes of Materials and Composites

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Students solve problems of choice and development of materials. They collect and analyze data about availability, properties and design options of materials necessary for given applications, and propose solutions to the problems of choice and design of materials.
description.et: Üliõpilased lahendavad materjalide valiku ja arendusega seotud probleeme, kogudes ja analüüsides infot etteantud rakendusteks vajalike materjalide olemasolu, omaduste ja  disainivõimaluste kohta ning pakkudes välja probleemide lahendamise võimalusi.

objectives.en: The goal of the course is development of the skills of students to solve problems in materials design, and to give supplementary knowledge about technological and structural materials, their properties, technologies and applications.
objectives.et: Eesmärgiks on üliõpilaste materjaliarenduslike probleemide lahendamise oskuse arendamine. Kinnistatakse teadmisi tehno- ja struktuursetest materjalidest, nende omadustest, valmistamise ja töötlemise tehnoloogiatest ning rakendustest.

learning_outcomes.en: After the course a student has systematic overview and broad-based knowledge about modern technological and structural materials, their properties, technologies and applications. He/she  is able to participate in reasearch of materials, can gather, analyze and present the results.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse läbinud üliõpilane omab süsteemset ülevaadet ja laiapõhjalisi teadmisi kaasaegsetest tehnomaterjalidest ja struktuursetest materjalidest, nende omadustest, tehnoloogiatest ja rakendusvaldkondadest. Ta on valmis osalema materjaliteaduse uurimistegevuses ning oskab erialaseid teadmisi koguda, analüüsida ja esitada.

description.et: The test checks acquiring of the basic terms and concepts by the students.
In the form of team work, students analyze and solve given problems of choice, application and development of materials. The results have to be presented in written reports and oral presentations.
Peer-reviews of a report of another team

grade_preconditions.et: The both tests must be passed, teamworks, reports and oral presentations done.

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade includes:
Homeworks, quizzes, seminar activity   20%
Tests on basic concepts  30%
Problem solution (teamwork)   40%
Peer-review of the presentation made by other team   10%

debt_elimination.et: In agreement with the lecturers at the end of the semester

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: William D.Callister, Jr., Dasvid G.Rethwisch. Materials Science and Engineering.
